sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Brazil's former president will be investigated for allegedly encouraging protests that ended with his supporters storming several government buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's army prepares for another night of gunfire as the battle for the eastern town of Soledad rages on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia rejects calls from UN Security Council members to end the war in Ukraine in the first emergency meeting this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro will be investigated for allegedly encouraging protests that ended with his supporters storming several government buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: buildings. In scenes reminiscent of the US Capitol Hill riots almost two years to the day, thousands invaded the country's Supreme Court, presidential palace, Congress and more last Sunday. Around 1,500 people were arrested and new president Lula da Silva has vowed that anyone involved will be found and punished with the full force of the law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On the outskirts of the salt mining town of Solida, Ukraine's army prepares for another night of gunfire and strikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's been the scene of some of the bloodiest fighting of the war so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Moscow claimed to capture the town yesterday, but Ukrainian officials say the battle rages on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This video shows Russian forces allegedly removing civilians from nearby towns, a move Kyiv calls forced evacuations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The tough battle for Donetsk region continues, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Although the enemy has concentrated its greatest forces in this direction, our troops are defending the state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: If Russia has taken Soledar, it would be seen as a win for its forces, who have experienced months of military losses, and would allow them to push on to other eastern towns like Sivoresk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Members of the United Nations Security Council have once again urged Russia to end its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, as the war nears the dreaded one-year mark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There is no sign of an end to the fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The logic that prevails is a military one, with very little, if any, room for dialogue right now. But all wars end and so too will this one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Council held its first emergency meeting this year on the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It is clear that there is no room for compromise with evil because if Ukraine stops fighting, it will die. The wall as we know it will die.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: If Russia stops its aggression, the war will end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It is as simple as that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But Russia has rejected the call, citing a threat from Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The U.S. criticized both North Korea and Russia, saying the world is tired of war and global threats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: An explosion in a gas pipeline in central Lithuania sent flames 50 metres into the air on Friday and forced the evacuation of a nearby village, according to officials. Local media said there were no reports of injuries. Firefighters were at the scene quickly but could do little other than look on while the remaining gas in the pipe was still burning. The operator company Amber Grid immediately cut off the tap on the pipeline, which runs parallel to another one and transports natural gas from Klaipeda on the Lithuanian coast to Latvia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Local media reported the Latvian energy minister as saying he'd been told the incident was a technical accident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After being acquitted of fraud charges, former Czech Prime Minister Andj Babis is in pole position in his country's presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's among eight candidates on the ballot, with voting spread over two days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But the billionaire businessman faces a stiff challenge from retired army general Petro Pavel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He is a political newcomer like the other main contender, economist Danusa Nerudova.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Pre-election polls suggest no candidate would win the election outright, so a run-off vote between the two top candidates appears likely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Polling also indicates both Pavel and Nerudova would defeat Babis in a final round.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The winner will replace the outspoken and Eurosceptic Milas Zeman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He was the first president to be elected by popular vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The role is largely ceremonial, but has become more politically resonant under Zeman's term.
